qas.question: Since what year has The Times and The Sunday Times had an online presense?
What is the URL of online website for The Times?
The website, thetimes.co.uk, is aimed at what kind of reader?
The website, thesundaytimes.co.uk, provides what kind of content?
How much does a non-subscriber of The Times need to pay to read the online versions?

context: The Times and The Sunday Times have had an online presence since March <a0_0>1999<a0_0/>, originally at the-times.co.uk and sunday-times.co.uk, and later at <a1_0>timesonline.co.uk<a1_0/>. There are now two websites: thetimes.co.uk is aimed at <a2_0>daily readers<a2_0/>, and the thesundaytimes.co.uk site at providing <a3_0>weekly magazine-like content<a3_0/>. There are also iPad and Android editions of both newspapers. Since July 2010, News UK has required readers who do not subscribe to the print edition to pay <a4_0>£2 per week<a4_0/> to read The Times and The Sunday Times online.
